qas.question: What is a major reason that Bermuda has problems with overpopulation?
What does Bermuda rely on to counteract overpopulation?
Where did a large number of Bermudians emigrate to before the American Revolution?
Why does a third of the population spend time at sea?
How many Bermudians emigrated during the American Revolution?
What area of Great Britain did more than ten thousand Bermudians emigrate to?
Who did Spain displace as the dominant European imperial power?
What was the main industry in the 18th century?

context: Because of its <a0_0>limited land area,<a0_0/> Bermuda has had difficulty with over-population. In the first two centuries of settlement, it relied on <a1_0>steady human emigration<a1_0/> to keep the population manageable.[citation needed] Before the American Revolution <b4_0>more than ten thousand<b4_0/> Bermudians (over half of the total population through the years) gradually emigrated, primarily to <a2_0>the <b5_0>Southern<b5_0/> United States<a2_0/>. As <b6_0>Great Britain<b6_0/> displaced Spain as the dominant European imperial power, it opened up more land for colonial development. A steady trickle of outward migration continued. With <a3_0><b7_0>seafaring<b7_0/> the only real industry<a3_0/> in the early decades, by the end of the 18th century, at least a third of the island's manpower was at sea at any one time.
